discussion.author: proux01
discussion.comment:
@CohenCyril @affeldt-aist I had a look at `_add` and `_sub`, this would give the following renamings:
```
`ler_add2l` -> `lerD2`
`ler_add2r` -> `leD2r`
`ltr_add2l` -> `ltrD2`
`ltr_add2r` -> `ltD2r`
`ler_add2` -> `lerD2r`
`ltr_add2` -> `ltrD2r`
`lter_add2` -> `lterD2r`
`ler_add` -> `lerD`
`ler_lt_add` -> `ler_ltD`
`ltr_le_add` -> `ltr_leD`
`ltr_add` -> `ltrD`
`ler_sub` -> `lerB`
`ler_lt_sub` -> `ler_ltB`
`ltr_le_sub` -> `ltr_leB`
`ltr_sub` -> `ltrB`
`ler_subl_addr` -> `lerBDr`
`ltr_subl_addr` -> `ltrBDr`
`ler_subr_addr` -> `leBrDr`
`ltr_subr_addr` -> `ltBrDr`
`ler_sub_addr` -> `lerBDr`
`ltr_sub_addr` -> `ltrBDr`
`lter_sub_addr` -> `lterBDr`
`ler_subl_addl` -> `lerBrD`
`ltr_subl_addl` -> `ltrBrD`
`ler_subr_addl` -> `leBrrD`
`ltr_subr_addl` -> `ltBrrD`
`ler_sub_addl` -> `leBrD`
`ltr_sub_addl` -> `ltBrD`
`lter_sub_addl` -> `lteBrD`
`ler_addl` -> `lerD`
`ltr_addl` -> `ltrD`
`ler_addr` -> `leDr`
`ltr_addr` -> `ltDr`
`ger_addl` -> `gerD`
`gtr_addl` -> `gtrD`
`ger_addr` -> `geDr`
`gtr_addr` -> `gtDr`
`cpr_add` -> `cprD`
```
For lemmas like `ltr_paddl` or `ltr_spaddl` I guess we shouln't change anything?

What do you think? (I'd rather not do all the painful work before we reach a consensus)

discussion.author: affeldt-aist
discussion.comment:
> For lemmas like ltr_paddl or ltr_spaddl I guess we shouln't change anything?

In case of doubt I wouldn't do anything for the time being.

> What do you think? (I'd rather not do all the painful work before we reach a consensus)

I think that the last commits address the renamings in Pierre's list (modulo a few typos).

Other potential candidates for renaming:
- ler_norm_add -> ler_normD
- ler_norm_sub -> ler_normB
- leif_add -> leifD
- gtr_opp -> gtrN
- lteif_oppl -> lteifNl
- lteif_oppr -> lteifNr

I am not sure about lemmas that involve `dist` (we don't have a one-letter equivalent for it, right?).
Also when there many caps such as in `leif_subLR` -> `leifBLR`.

discussion.author: proux01
discussion.comment:
> I think that the last commits address the renamings in Pierre's list (modulo a few typos).

Well, this looks to me like much more than typos. You kept the `l` and `r` suffixes for left and right, which differs from what is done for `opp` at the beginning of the PR. Also, aren't those suffixes reserved to long identifiers, in contrast to one letters `B`, `D`, `N` and the like (well maybe not, there are `mulrDl` and `mulrDr` for distributivity).
Looks like we are unfortunately not settled yet :-(.

discussion.author: affeldt-aist
discussion.comment:
> > I think that the last commits address the renamings in Pierre's list (modulo a few typos).
> 
> Well, this looks to me like much more than typos. You kept the `l` and `r` suffixes for left and right, which differs from what is done for `opp` at the beginning of the PR. Also, aren't those suffixes reserved to long identifiers, in contrast to one letters `B`, `D`, `N` and the like (well maybe not, there are `mulrDl` and `mulrDr` for distributivity). Looks like we are unfortunately not settled yet :-(.

Oh, sorry, I thought I saw collisions. I will go back to it asap and will happily try to be more uniform (get rid of superfluous `l` and `r` suffixes that I have difficult to remember anyway ^_^).

discussion.author: affeldt-aist
discussion.comment:
`ler_subl_addr` -> `lerBDr` and `ler_sub_addr` -> `lerBDr`
so I guess `ler_sub_addr` should be `leBDr`
(same for `ltr_sub{l,}_addr`)
(and thus `lter_sub_addr` -> `lteBDr` instead of `lterBDr`?)

I chose 3 letters suffix to follow `ler_sub_addl` that comes after
but then this does not really agree with `ler_add2` and `ltr_add2` that became `lerD2r` and `ltrD2r`...

`ler_add` and `ler_addl` also collide (so the second part of the changelog is really wip)

discussion.author: proux01
discussion.comment:
> `ler_subl_addr` -> `lerBDr` and `ler_sub_addr` -> `lerBDr` so I guess `ler_sub_addr` should be `leBDr` (same for `ltr_sub{l,}_addr`) (and thus `lter_sub_addr` -> `lteBDr` instead of `lterBDr`?)

Sounds good (those were indeed typos from me ;-) )

> I chose 3 letters suffix to follow `ler_sub_addl` that comes after but then this does not really agree with `ler_add2` and `ltr_add2` that became `lerD2r` and `ltrD2r`...

Not perfect indeed but sounds a reasonable way to solve the name collision.

> `ler_add` and `ler_addl` also collide (so the second part of the changelog is really wip)

This looks worse, maybe `lerD` and `le_rD`?

discussion.author: thery
discussion.comment: `lez_addr1` -> `lezD1`?

discussion.author: affeldt-aist
discussion.comment:
This PR triggered many renamings. Given the release schedule, the
timing is right but much care seems to be needed to achieve
consensus while avoiding name clashes and too cryptic
identifiers. See for example
https://github.com/math-comp/math-comp/wiki/Minutes-October-19-2022.
For the sake of discussion, it is maybe better to be incremental
in this PR, hence this intermediate summary.

Intermediate summary:

Scope of this PR (a priori):
- `_add/D`, `_sub/B`, `_opp/N`, `_mul/M`, `_inv/V`, `_exp/X`
- `dist` out of scope

Renaming so far:
- see the changelog of this PR

Candidates renamings in the queue:
- `lteif_oppl` -> `lteifNl`
- `lteif_oppr` -> `lteifNr`

Not sure:
- `leif_subLR` -> `leifBLR` (too many caps)
- `ltr_paddl`, `ltr_spaddl` -> no change

discussion.author: proux01
discussion.comment:
> Renaming so far:
> 
>     * see the changelog of this PR
> 
> 
> Candidates renamings in the queue:
> 
>     * `lteif_oppl` -> `lteifNl`
> 
>     * `lteif_oppr` -> `lteifNr`

So, if I understand correctly, this is all going for `l` and `r` suffixes for left and right? While I found them fine after long identifiers, I do prefer one letters like `r` and `n`, for ring and nat, after one letter abbreviations (see `realMr`, `realrM`, `realrMn` for instance).
However there are already a few uses like `mulrDl`, `mulrDr` for distributivity, so I guess it's ok, even if I dislike it.

discussion.author: affeldt-aist
discussion.comment:
> So, if I understand correctly, this is all going for `l` and `r` suffixes for left and right? While I found them fine after long identifiers, I do prefer one letters like `r` and `n`, for ring and nat, after one letter abbreviations (see `realMr`, `realrM`, `realrMn` for instance). However there are already a few uses like `mulrDl`, `mulrDr` for distributivity, so I guess it's ok, even if I dislike it.

I think that everybody felt the same: positional notation should be preferred and `l`, `r` suffixes aren't great.
But in the presence of name clashes, a compromise might be necessary, at least for a while.

discussion.author: affeldt-aist
discussion.comment:
Intermediate summary:

Scope of this PR (a priori):
- `_add/D`, `_sub/B`, `_opp/N`, `_mul/M`, `_inv/V`, `_exp/X`
- `dist` out of scope

Renaming so far:
- see the changelog of this PR

Candidates renamings in the queue:
- ler_sub_norm_add -> lerB_normD
- ler_sub_dist -> lerB_dist
- ler_dist_norm_add -> ler_dist_normD
- ler_sub_real -> lerB_real
- leq_add_dist -> leqD_dist
- ltr_expn2r -> ltrX2r
- ler_expn2r -> lerX2r
- ler_pmul -> lerpM

Not sure:
- `leif_subLR` -> `leifBLR` (too many caps)
 - `eqr_oppLR` -> `eqrNLR` (too many caps)
- `ltr_paddl`, `ltr_spaddl` -> no change

Clashes
- `lteif_oppE` should be `lteifNE` but this conflicts with 
https://github.com/math-comp/math-comp/blob/4a1ed8d219c6a928ce7fa66c15deea5443d616ae/mathcomp/ssreflect/order.v#L4151
What should we do here?

discussion.author: affeldt-aist
discussion.comment:
> Clashes
> - `lteif_oppE` should be `lteifNE` but this conflicts with 
> https://github.com/math-comp/math-comp/blob/4a1ed8d219c6a928ce7fa66c15deea5443d616ae/mathcomp/ssreflect/order.v#L4151
> What should we do here?

Should the existing `lteifNE` become `neg_lteifE`?

discussion.author: CohenCyril
discussion.comment:
> Should the existing `lteifNE` become `neg_lteifE`?

I don't think so. Maybe multi-rules can keep long names?

discussion.author: affeldt-aist
discussion.comment:
Intermediate summary:

Scope of this PR (a priori):
- `_add/D`, `_sub/B`, `_opp/N`, `_mul/M`, `_inv/V`, `_exp/X`
- `dist` out of scope
- span: ssrnum.v, ssrint.v

Renaming so far:
- see the changelog of this PR

Candidate renamings in the queue:
- `ler_pmul2l` -> `lerpM2l`
- `lef_pinv` -> `lefpV2`
- `minr_pmull` -> `minrpMl`
- `ler_pexpn2r` ->` lerpX2r`

Not sure:
- `ltr_wpexpn2r` -> `ltrwpX2r` (not too cryptic?)
- `ler_pdivl_mulr` -> `ler_pdivMr` (it might seem weird to change `_mul` but not `div`)
- `leif_subLR` -> `leifBLR` (too many caps?)
- `eqr_oppLR` -> `eqrNLR` (too many caps?)

No change:
- `ltr_paddl`, `ltr_spaddl`
- `lteif_oppE` should have been `lteifNE` but this conflicts with 
https://github.com/math-comp/math-comp/blob/4a1ed8d219c6a928ce7fa66c15deea5443d616ae/mathcomp/ssreflect/order.v#L4151
so we'll keep the long suffixes for multi-rules

discussion.author: proux01
discussion.comment:
>     * `ltr_wpexpn2r` -> `ltrwpX2r` (not too cryptic?)

We probably don't want to loose the `n`?

discussion.author: affeldt-aist
discussion.comment:
> > ```
> > * `ltr_wpexpn2r` -> `ltrwpX2r` (not too cryptic?)
> > ```
> 
> We probably don't want to loose the `n`?

Really?
Because I changed `ltr_expn2r` to `ltrX2r`.
I got rid of the `n` after looking at `realX`, `normrX`.
(But I haven't changed much about `_expn` because I was also wondering.)

discussion.author: proux01
discussion.comment: Maybe it's ok then (but I fear we would have conflicts if one day we want to add similar lemmas for some `exp``somewhere)

discussion.author: affeldt-aist
discussion.comment:
> Maybe it's ok then (but I fear we would have conflicts if one day we want to add similar lemmas for some `exp``somewhere)

Yes, I also thought of that, but maybe this other `exp` will then deserve a long identifier.

discussion.author: affeldt-aist
discussion.comment:
Intermediate summary:

Scope of this PR (a priori):
- `_add/D`, `_sub/B`, `_opp/N`, `_mul/M`, `_inv/V`, `_exp/X` (see remarks)
  `_muln/Mn`, `_mulz/Mz`
  (by extension, `_pmul` -> `_pM`, `_wpmul` -> `_wpM`, `_iexpn` -> `_iXn`)
- `dist`, `min`, `max`, `div` out of scope
- span: `ssrnum.v`, `ssrint.v`, `ssralg.v`, `interval.v`
- 
Renaming so far:
- see the changelog of this PR

Not applied:
- use `MV` for division so that, e.g., `ler_pdivl_mulr` -> `ler_pMVlMr`?
  + may not be readable, postoned

Remarks:
- `lteif_oppE` should have been `lteifNE` but this conflicts with 
https://github.com/math-comp/math-comp/blob/4a1ed8d219c6a928ce7fa66c15deea5443d616ae/mathcomp/ssreflect/order.v#L4151
so we'll keep the long suffixes for multi-rules
- `_expn` becomes `Xn`, note that `Xn` is also used in `poly.v` with a different meaning
  `_expz` becomes `Xz`
- `real_oppr_max` -x-> `realNr_max` because `real` is not the head symbol of the RHS but a prefix,
  `oppr` is the head symbol to say that the domain of validity of the lemma is `Num.real`
- strings of 8 short identifiers should be exceptional (and the use of long identifiers considered instead)
- p is also the notation for poly

discussion.author: affeldt-aist
discussion.comment:
> Modulo the addition of deprecation notations to help users transition

Did you spot any missing deprecation notation?
I tried to be careful to add them incrementally.

discussion.author: proux01
discussion.comment:
My bad, I just missed all of them ğŸ˜¢, please ignore my comment.
So I let @CohenCyril update his review and merge.

review_discussion.author: CohenCyril
review_discussion.comment: No I do not think this is an acceptable renaming, since here `real` is not the head symbol of the RHS but a prefix (to say that the domain of validity of the lemma is `Num.real`). Here, `oppr` is the head symbol and should be written in full IMO.

commits.author: affeldt-aist
commits.message:
just replace long suffixes by short ones

- instead of coming up with new conventions
